content: I'm working on a proof that involves showing f(x) <= g(x) from f(0) <= g(0) and f'(x) <= g'(x). I can get it working using the fundamental theorem of calculus, but given that it's a fairly common argument I'm wondering if this might exist as a lemma in mathlib already?
You can get it from MVT (Cauchy form), no need to use integrals.
If this lemma is not in the file about MVT, then it makes sense to add it there. I'm on the phone, so can't check rn
You're totally right, thanks! For posterity, I was looking for mul_sub_le_image_sub_of_le_deriv.
Markus de Medeiros has marked this topic as resolved.
